ctx: intros p k a b n q r Hp Hrel H0r Hrn Hb0.
exceptions.tactic: apply nth_root_irrat with (r := r) (b := b) (n := n); auto.
exceptions.exn: In environment p, k, a, b, n, q, r : nat Hp : is_prime p Hrel : rel_prime p k H0r : 0 < r Hrn : r < n Hb0 : b <> 0 Unable to unify "power ?M1416 r * ?M1417 * power b n = power ?M1418 n" with "power p (q * n + r) * k * power b n = power a n".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall p k a b n q r : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> 0 < r -> r < n -> b <> 0 -> power p (q * n + r) * k * power b n <> power a n

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
rel_prime = fun a b : nat => is_gcd 1 a b : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments rel_prime (_ _)%nat_scope
nth_root_irrat : forall p k a b n r : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> 0 < r -> r < n -> b <> 0 -> power p r * k * power b n <> power a n
nth_root_irrat_aux : forall p k a b n r : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> 0 < r -> r < n -> rel_prime a b -> power p r * k * power b n <> power a n
sqrt_prime_irrat : forall p k a b : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> b <> 0 -> p * k * square b <> square a
sqrt_prime_irrat_aux : forall p k a b : nat, is_prime p -> rel_prime p k -> rel_prime a b -> p * k * square b <> square a
is_power_m_dec : forall n m : nat, m > 0 -> {x : nat | n = power x m} + {p : nat & {q : nat & {r : nat & {k : nat | is_prime p /\ 0 < r /\ r < m /\ n = power p (q * m + r) * k /\ rel_prime p k}}}}
wf_power_dec : forall (n : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_wf l -> n > 0 -> {x : nat | refactor l = power x n} + {p : nat & {q : nat & {r : nat & {k : nat | is_prime p /\ 0 < r /\ r < n /\ refactor l = power p (q * n + r) * k /\ rel_prime p k}}}}
sqrt_prime : forall p : nat, is_prime p -> forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> p * square b <> square a
nat_factor_prime : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> n <> 1 -> {p : nat & {m : nat & {q : nat | is_prime p /\ m > 0 /\ n = power p m * q /\ is_gcd 1 p q /\ q < n}}}
power_lt : forall p m : nat, 1 < p -> 0 < m -> 1 < power p m
gcd_non_zero : forall d p q : nat, q <> 0 -> is_gcd d p q -> d <> 0
prime_mult : forall p a b : nat, is_prime p -> divides (a * b) p -> divides a p \/ divides b p
mult_lemma6 : forall a b n : nat, n <> 0 -> n * a = n * b -> a = b
prime_cond : forall p : nat, p <> 1 /\ (forall a : nat, a <> 1 -> a <> p -> ~ divides p a) < -> is_prime p
mult_lt_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> 0 < p -> n * p < m * p
euclide.divides_le : forall a b : nat, a <> 0 -> divides a b -> b <= a
prime_power_qn : forall p n q x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) (power p (q * n)) -> 1 <= n -> divides x (power p q)
Nat.crossmul_le_addsquare : forall a b : nat, 0 <= a -> 0 <= b -> b * a + a * b <= a * a + b * b
minus_lt_lemma1 : forall b a : nat, a < b -> 0 < b - a
prime_div_gcd : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ divides a p -> rel_prime p a
prime_rel_prime : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ rel_prime a p -> divides a p
gcd_prime : forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> (forall d a : nat, is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p) -> is_prime p
Nat.pow_neg_r : forall a b : nat, b < 0 -> a ^ b = 0
divides_prime : forall a : nat, (exists p : nat, p <> a /\ is_prime p /\ divides a p) -> ~ is_prime a
euclide.quotient_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
euclide.remainder_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
nat_factor : forall n p : nat, is_prime p -> n <> 0 -> {m : nat | divides n (power p m) /\ ~ divides n (power p (m + 1))}
power_power_rel_prime : forall a n b m : nat, n > 0 -> m > 0 -> rel_prime (power a n) (power b m) < -> rel_prime a b
Nat.quadmul_le_squareadd : forall a b : nat, 0 <= a -> 0 <= b -> 2 * 2 * a * b <= (a + b) * (a + b)
rel_prime_mult : forall a b c : nat, rel_prime a b -> rel_prime a c -> rel_prime a (b * c)
euclide.divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}

```coq
intros p k a b n q r Hp Hrel H0r Hrn Hb0.
apply nth_root_irrat with (r := r) (b := b) (n := n); auto.
Qed.
```

original: intros p k a b n q r Hp Hrel H0r Hrn Hb0. apply nth_root_irrat with (r := r) (b := b) (n := n); auto.
